Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Lobar and Sublobar Resection in Peripheral cT1aN0 NSCLC

Trial_Design.evidence: Conducted as a randomised controlled trial, 697 patients were recruited from June 2007 to March 2017.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to either LR (357) or sublobar resection (SLR) (340)

Objective.evidence: This study investigates the differences in disease-free survival (DFS), overall survival (OS), and lung cancer-specific survival (LCSS)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was DFS over a five-year period.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence with allocation concealment.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was not implemented for outcome assessors, patients, or clinicians.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 697 patients were recruited from June 2007 to March 2017.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Five-year DFS rates were 64.7% for LR, 63.8% for SR, and 62.5% for WR (p = 0.888).

Harms.evidence: No significant adverse events were reported.
